t: Mark 8
Feeding the Four Thousand
In*p those days, the multitude being very great and having nothing to eat, Jesus called His disciples to*i Him*i and said to them,
“I*r have*r compassion*r on*r the*r multitude,*r because*r they*r have*r now*r continued*r with*r Me*r three*r days*r and*r have*r nothing*r to*r eat.*r
And*r if*r I*r send*r them*r away*r hungry*r to*r their*r own*r houses,*r they*r will*r faint*r on*r the*r way;*r for*r some*r of*r them*r have*r come*r from*r afar.”*r
Then*p His disciples answered Him, “How can one satisfy these people with bread here in the wilderness?”
He*p asked them, “How*r many*r loaves*r do*r you*r have?”*r And*p they said, “Seven.”

So*p He commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground. And He took the seven loaves and gave thanks, broke them*i and gave them*i to His disciples to set before them;*i and they set them*i before the multitude.
They also had a few small fish; and having blessed them, He said to set them also before them.*i
So they ate and were filled, and they took up seven large baskets of leftover fragments.
Now those who had eaten were about four thousand. And He sent them away,
immediately got into the boat with His disciples, and came to the region of Dalmanutha.
The Pharisees Seek a Sign
Then*p the Pharisees came out and began to dispute with Him, seeking from Him a sign from heaven, testing Him.
But He sighed deeply in His spirit, and said, “Why*r does*r this*r generation*r seek*r a*r sign?*r Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r no*r sign*r shall*r be*r given*r to*r this*r generation.”*r
Beware of the Leaven of the Pharisees and Herod
And*p He left them, and getting into the boat again, departed to the other side.
Now the disciples had forgotten to take bread, and they did not have more than one loaf with them in the boat.
Then He charged them, saying, “Take*r heed,*r beware*r of*r the*r leaven*r of*r the*r Pharisees*r and*r the*r leaven*r of*r Herod.”*r
And*p they reasoned among themselves, saying, “It*i is*i because we have no bread.”

But*p Jesus, being aware of it,*i said to them, “Why*r do*r you*r reason*r because*r you*r have*r no*r bread?*r Do*r you*r not*r yet*r perceive*r nor*r understand?*r Is*r your*r heart*r still*r hardened?*r
Having*r eyes,*r do*r you*r not*r see?*r And*r having*r ears,*r do*r you*r not*r hear?*r And*r do*r you*r not*r remember?*r
When*r I*r broke*r the*r five*r loaves*r for*r the*r five*r thousand,*r how*r many*r baskets*r full*r of*r fragments*r did*r you*r take*r up?”*r They*p said to Him, “Twelve.”
“Also,*rp when*r I*r broke*r the*r seven*r for*r the*r four*r thousand,*r how*r many*r large*r baskets*r full*r of*r fragments*r did*r you*r take*r up?”*r And*p they said, “Seven.”
So*p He said to them, “How*r is*ir it*ir you*r do*r not*r understand?”*r
A Blind Man Healed at Bethsaida
Then*p He came to Bethsaida; and they brought a blind man to Him, and begged Him to touch him.
So He took the blind man by the hand and led him out of the town. And when He had spit on his eyes and put His hands on him, He asked him if he saw anything.
And*p he looked up and said, “I see men like trees, walking.”
Then*p He put His*i hands on his eyes again and made him look up. And he was restored and saw everyone clearly.
Then He sent him away to his house, saying, “Neither*r go*r into*r the*r town,*r nor*r tell*r anyone*r in*r the*r town.”*r
Peter Confesses Jesus as the Christ
Now*p Jesus and His disciples went out to the towns of Caesarea Philippi; and on the road He asked His disciples, saying to them, “Who*r do*r men*r say*r that*r I*r am?”*r
So*p they answered, “John the Baptist; but some say,*i Elijah; and others, one of the prophets.”
He*p said to them, “But*r who*r do*r you*r say*r that*r I*r am?”*r Peter*p answered and said to Him, “You are the Christ.”
Then*p He strictly warned them that they should tell no one about Him.
Jesus Predicts His Death and Resurrection
And*p He began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.
He spoke this word openly. Then Peter took Him aside and began to rebuke Him.

But when He had turned around and looked at His disciples, He rebuked Peter, saying, “Get*r behind*r Me,*r Satan!*r For*r you*r are*r not*r mindful*r of*r the*r things*r of*r God,*r but*r the*r things*r of*r men.”*r
Take Up the Cross and Follow Him

When*p He had called the people to Himself,*i with His disciples also, He said to them, “Whoever*r desires*r to*r come*r after*r Me,*r let*r him*r deny*r himself,*r and*r take*r up*r his*r cross,*r and*r follow*r Me.*r
For*r whoever*r desires*r to*r save*r his*r life*r will*r lose*r it,*r but*r whoever*r loses*r his*r life*r for*r My*r sake*r and*r the*r gospel’s*r will*r save*r it.*r
For*r what*r will*r it*r profit*r a*r man*r if*r he*r gains*r the*r whole*r world,*r and*r loses*r his*r own*r soul?*r
Or*r what*r will*r a*r man*r give*r in*r exchange*r for*r his*r soul?*r

For*r whoever*r is*r ashamed*r of*r Me*r and*r My*r words*r in*r this*r adulterous*r and*r sinful*r generation,*r of*r him*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r also*r will*r be*r ashamed*r when*r He*r comes*r in*r the*r glory*r of*r His*r Father*r with*r the*r holy*r angels.”*r
